trans-unit.source: Converts data input to the format used by the SVM-Light framework
trans-unit.target: Converts data input to the format used by the SVM-Light framework

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Convert to SVMLight</ui> module to convert your datasets or results to the format that is used by SVMLight.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Convert to SVMLight</ui> module to convert your datasets or results to the format that is used by SVMLight.

trans-unit.source: The SVM-Light framework was developed by researchers at Cornell University.
trans-unit.target: The SVM-Light framework was developed by researchers at Cornell University.

trans-unit.source: The SVM-Light library implements Vapnik's Support Vector Machine, and it can be used for many machine learning tasks, including classification and regression.
trans-unit.target: The SVM-Light library implements Vapnik's Support Vector Machine, and it can be used for many machine learning tasks, including classification and regression.

trans-unit.source: For additional details about the format used by SVMLight, see <externalLink><linkText>SVMLight Support Vector Machine</linkText><linkUri>http://svmlight.joachims.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details about the format used by SVMLight, see <externalLink><linkText>SVMLight Support Vector Machine</linkText><linkUri>http://svmlight.joachims.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Although there are no examples specific to this format, you can see examples of how format conversion is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: Although there are no examples specific to this format, you can see examples of how format conversion is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>color quantization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> exports the datasets that are used for each portion of the analysis to files for reproducibility and use on other analytics platforms.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>color quantization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> exports the datasets that are used for each portion of the analysis to files for reproducibility and use on other analytics platforms.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink> sample exports the results of cross validation to files so that results for multiple models can be compared by using a tool such as Excel.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink> sample exports the results of cross validation to files so that results for multiple models can be compared by using a tool such as Excel.

trans-unit.source: The executables provided in the SVM-Light framework require both an example file and a model file.
trans-unit.target: The executables provided in the SVM-Light framework require both an example file and a model file.

trans-unit.source: However, this module creates only the example file.
trans-unit.target: However, this module creates only the example file.

trans-unit.source: You must create the model file by using the SVMLight libraries.
trans-unit.target: You must create the model file by using the SVMLight libraries.

trans-unit.source: The example file contains training data in this format:
trans-unit.target: The example file contains training data in this format:

trans-unit.source: Comments must be prefixed with the number sign (#).
trans-unit.target: Comments must be prefixed with the number sign (#).

trans-unit.source: The file format output by <ui>Convert to SVMLight</ui> does not create headers.
trans-unit.target: The file format output by <ui>Convert to SVMLight</ui> does not create headers.

trans-unit.source: Each case consists of a target value followed by a series of indices and the associated feature values.
trans-unit.target: Each case consists of a target value followed by a series of indices and the associated feature values.

trans-unit.source: The response value must be 1 or -1 for classification, or a number for regression.
trans-unit.target: The response value must be 1 or -1 for classification, or a number for regression.

trans-unit.source: The target value and each of the index-value pairs are separated by a space.
trans-unit.target: The target value and each of the index-value pairs are separated by a space.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you prepare your dataset in advance by using <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> and <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to ensure that the feature and label columns are marked appropriately.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you prepare your dataset in advance by using <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> and <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to ensure that the feature and label columns are marked appropriately.
